arm_group.description: Test product: Salad with high dosage fat
Control product: Salad with low dosage fat

brief_summary.textblock:
The hypothesis will be tested that fat can also increase absorption of (non)-nutrients from
      a salad. Therefore we designed the current study to show an increase in relative absorption
      (bioavailability) of  (non-) nutrients from a mixed salad by adding fat containing dressing.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of the Relative Increase in Bioavailability of (Non-) Nutrients From a Mixed Salad by Adding Fat Containing Dressing

criteria.textblock:
Main inclusion Criteria:

          -  Body mass index (BMI) ≥ 18.5 and ≤ 30.0 kg/m2.

          -  Apparently healthy: no medical conditions, no use of prescribed or over the   counter
             drugs, which might affect study measurements (as judged by study physician)

          -  Haemoglobin within normal reference range as judged by the study physician.

          -  Total cholesterol, LDL cholesterol, HDL cholesterol and fasting triglycerides within
             the normal reference range, as judged by the study physician.

        Main exclusion Criteria:

          -  Reported use of any medically- or self-prescribed diet at the moment of screening, or
             the intention to use any kind of diet in the period between screening and the end of
             the study.

          -  Reported weight loss or gain ≥ 10 % of bodyweight during a period of six months
             before screening.

          -  A known food allergy or intolerance.

          -  A dislike to the foods supplied during the study.

          -  Use of vitamins or supplements enriched with carotenoid and/or vitamin A  and/of
             vitamin K.

          -  Known hypothyroidism or hyperthyroidism.

intervention.intervention_name: Test product: Salad with a high dosage fat
Control product: Salad with low dosage fat

address.state: Av. Dr. Enéas de Carvalho Aguiar, 44

facility.name: Instituto do Coração - Hospital das Clínicas da Faculdade de Medicina da Universidade de São Paulo / Incor HC FM USP

clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of the Relative Increase in Bioavailability of (Non-) Nutrients From a Mixed Salad by Adding Fat Containing Dressing

overall_official.affiliation: Head Professor of Clinical Biochemistry, Faculty of Pharmaceutical Sciences Director, Lipid Metabolism Laboratory
overall_official.last_name: Dr. Raul C. Maranhão, M.D, Ph.D.

primary_outcome.description: Area under the curve (AUC in nmol/l*h) of (non) nutrients. The AUCs are constructed from (non-) nutrient levels measured in plasma chylomicrons at the selected time-points. The size of the areas under the curves will be compared between the test and control dressing.
primary_outcome.measure: Area under the curve (AUC in nmol/l*h) of (non) nutrients

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Bio-availability Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Prevention
